verses.roman:
pratyākhyātaḥ sa cākrūraṁ
pārṣṇi-grāham ayācata
so 'py āha ko virudhyeta
vidvān īśvarayor balam

synonyms: pratyākhyātaḥ—refused; saḥ—he, Śatadhanvā; ca—and; akrūram—Akrūra; pārṣṇi-grāham—for help; ayācata—begged; saḥ—he, Akrūra; api—also; āha—said; kaḥ—who; virudhyeta—can stand against; vidvān—knowing; īśvarayoḥ—of the two Personalities of Godhead; balam—the strength.
translation: His appeal refused, Śatadhanvā went to Akrūra and begged him for protection. But Akrūra similarly told him, "Who would oppose the two Personalities of Godhead if he knew Their strength?
